original: Mollstadius, Carl Johan Axel, överstelöjtnant, Jönköping, f. 4/11/89 i Trelleborg av reg ipastorn v. A. 3 Alexander M. o. Carolina Svensson. G. 16-34 m. Annie Adelskötid. Barn: Carl-Henric f. 16, kapten v. A. 6, Claes 20, ’löjtn. v. F. 14, Lajla 25. — Mogiex. i Kristianstad 08, AIHS 12-13, Rs 14- 15, ArtSS 17, 29 o. 35, VOK 19, InfSS 21, KHS 22-24, MFK 25-26. Und:löjtn. v. Norrl. art:reg. 10, löjtn. 14, kapt. 25, v. Smål. arméart :reg 28, major i armén 35, v. reg. 36, öv:löjtn. i arm^én 38, v. reg. 39, i res. 45. Vapenoff. i Boden 18-19, adjut. 19-22, chef f. stud:-•avd. 24-25, gen :stabsasp. 26-29, batt:-chef 29-30 o. 32-35, stabschef h. mil:-befälh. på Gotl. 30-32, divxhef 36-45, skjutfälts- o. kasernoff. fr. 45. Bitr. ’led. av komm. f. beredn. av centr. försv :förvaltn. 27, sekr. i Bodens fält-rittkl. 19-21, ordf. li A. 6 idrifören. 35-38 o. i kamratfören. Smålandsartil-lerister fr. 41. Skr.: Jönekiöpings Fäldtartollerie 1637-1700 samt åtskill. upps. i mii., hist. o. geneal. ämnen. RSO, SkytteM.
translated: Mollstadius, Carl Johan Axel, Lieutenant Colonel, Jönköping, born on November 4, 1889 in Trelleborg. Son of Regimental Pastor V. A. 3 Alexander M. and Carolina Svensson. Married from 1916 to 1934 to Annie Adelskötid. Children: Carl-Henric, born in 1916, Captain in the Army, Claes, born in 1920, Lieutenant in the Navy, Lajla, born in 1925. Divorced in Kristianstad in 1908. Served in AIHS 1912-1913, Rs 1914-1915, ArtSS 1917, 1929, and 1935, VOK 1919, InfSS 1921, KHS 1922-1924, MFK 1925-1926. Second Lieutenant in the Northern Artillery Regiment 1910, Lieutenant in 1914, Captain in 1925, in Småland Army Artillery Regiment 1928, Major in the Army 1935, in the regiment 1936, Lieutenant Colonel in the Army 1938, in the regiment 1939, in the reserve 1945. Weapon Officer in Boden 1918-1919, Adjutant 1919-1922, Head of the Study Division 1924-1925, General Staff Aspirant 1926-1929, Battalion Chief 1929-1930 and 1932-1935, Chief of Staff under the Military Commander on Gotland 1930-1932, Division Chief 1936-1945, Range and Barracks Officer from 1945. Assistant member of the Commission for the Preparation of Central Defense Administration in 1927, Secretary of the Boden Equestrian Club 1919-1921, Chairman of the A. 6 Sports Club from 1935-1938, and the Småland Artillery Association from 1941. Wrote: "Jönköpings Field Artillery 1637-1700" and several essays on military, historical, and genealogical subjects. Awarded RSO, SkytteM.

structured.name: Carl Johan Axel Mollstadius
